title: Delhi Cloth And General Mills Co. Ltd. v. Hem Chand
headline: Landmark case on landlord-tenant disputes where the court held that a tenant cannot be evicted without following due process under the Rent Control Act. The court established that tenants have a right to security of tenure and the landlord must prove bona fide need for eviction...

citeList.title: Hem Chand v. The Delhi Cloth & General Mills Co. Ltd.

title: Chinnamarkathian v. Ayyavoo
headline: Supreme Court case on recovery of security deposit by tenant from landlord after termination of tenancy. The court held that a landlord is bound to refund the security deposit after the tenant vacates the premises, and failure to do so entitles the tenant to claim interest...

title: CBSE v. Aditya Bandopadhyay
headline: Supreme Court landmark judgment on the scope and limits of the Right to Information Act, 2005. The court held that while RTI promotes transparency, it cannot be used as a tool of surveillance. The court directed that examination answer sheets are personal information of the candidate...

title: Registrar of Companies v. Dharmendra Kumar Garg
headline: Delhi High Court case interpreting the Right to Information Act in the context of corporate regulatory bodies. The court held that the Registrar of Companies is a public authority under the RTI Act and must disclose information relating to company filings and compliance...

title: Kannamma v. Deputy General Manager
headline: Supreme Court case on motor vehicle accident compensation where the court established principles for computing just compensation for victims of road accidents. The court held that the multiplier method should be applied based on age and income of the deceased...

title: Sarla Mudgal v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court held that a Hindu husband who converts to Islam and marries again without dissolving the first Hindu marriage is guilty of bigamy under Section 494 of the Indian Penal Code. The court emphasized the need for a Uniform Civil Code under Article 44...

title: Smt. Saroj Rani v. Sudarshan Kumar Chadha
headline: Supreme Court case on restitution of conjugal rights under Hindu Marriage Act. The court upheld the constitutional validity of Section 9 of the Hindu Marriage Act providing for restitution of conjugal rights, rejecting the challenge that it violates fundamental rights...

title: Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar
headline: Supreme Court laid down guidelines to prevent automatic arrest in cases under Section 498A IPC (dowry harassment) and Section 4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act. The court directed that police must follow the checklist under Section 41(1)(b) CrPC before making any arrest...

title: S.R. Bommai v. Union of India
headline: Landmark Supreme Court judgment on the scope of President's Rule under Article 356 of the Constitution. The court held that the power under Article 356 is not absolute and is subject to judicial review. The proclamation under Article 356 must be approved by Parliament...

title: Indra Sawhney v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court landmark judgment on reservation policy where the court upheld the 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes in government jobs. The court imposed a ceiling of 50% on total reservations and excluded the 'creamy layer' from OBC reservations...

title: MC Mehta v. Union of India (Oleum Gas Leak)
headline: Supreme Court established the principle of absolute liability for industries engaged in hazardous activities. The court held that enterprises owing an absolute duty to the community to ensure no harm results from hazardous activities, going beyond the rule in Rylands v. Fletcher...

title: Indian Council for Enviro-Legal Action v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court case on industrial pollution where chemical industries in Rajasthan were held liable for contaminating groundwater and soil. The court applied the polluter pays principle and directed closure of polluting industries and payment of compensation to affected villagers...

citeList.title: MC Mehta v. Union of India (Oleum Gas Leak)

title: Shreya Singhal v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court struck down Section 66A of the Information Technology Act, 2000 as unconstitutional, holding that it violated the fundamental right to free speech under Article 19(1)(a). The court distinguished between discussion, advocacy and incitement...

title: Lily Thomas v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court held that a person who is in jail or police custody on the date of filing nomination or on the date of scrutiny cannot contest elections. The court struck down Section 8(4) of the Representation of the People Act as unconstitutional...

title: Subramanian Swamy v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court upheld the constitutional validity of the criminal defamation provisions under Sections 499 and 500 of the Indian Penal Code. The court held that the right to reputation is an integral part of Article 21 and the reasonable restriction on free speech under Article 19(2)...

title: Lalita Kumari v. State of UP
headline: Supreme Court held that registration of FIR is mandatory under Section 154 CrPC if the information discloses cognizable offence and no preliminary inquiry is required. The court laid down guidelines for when preliminary inquiry may be conducted before registering FIR...

title: Githa Hariharan v. Reserve Bank of India
headline: Supreme Court held that the mother can act as natural guardian of a minor child even during the lifetime of the father. The court interpreted Section 6(a) of the Hindu Minority and Guardianship Act in light of gender equality under Articles 14 and 15...

title: Shah Bano Begum v. Mohammad Ahmed Khan
headline: Landmark Supreme Court judgment on maintenance rights of divorced Muslim women under Section 125 CrPC. The court held that a Muslim husband is liable to pay maintenance to his divorced wife beyond the iddat period if she is unable to maintain herself...

title: Dashrath Rupsingh Rathod v. State of Maharashtra
headline: Supreme Court dealt with the issue of territorial jurisdiction in cheque dishonour cases under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act. The court held that the complaint must be filed at the place where the cheque is dishonored by the drawee bank...

title: BSNL v. BPL Mobile Communications Ltd.
headline: Supreme Court case on arbitration where the court held that the appointment of an arbitrator must be in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The court emphasized party autonomy in selection of arbitrator and held that unilateral appointment by one party is invalid...

title: D.K. Basu v. State of West Bengal
headline: Supreme Court laid down 11 guidelines to prevent custodial violence and torture. The court held that custodial death is one of the worst crimes in a civilized society and directed that every police station must prominently display the guidelines for arrest and detention...

title: National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court recognized transgender persons as the third gender and affirmed their fundamental rights under Articles 14, 15, 16, 19, and 21 of the Constitution. The court directed the government to treat them as socially and educationally backward classes...

title: Mohd. Ahmed Khan v. Shah Bano Begum
headline: Supreme Court ruled that Section 125 CrPC applies to all women irrespective of religion. The court held that a divorced Muslim woman is entitled to maintenance from her former husband until she remarries, establishing that personal law cannot override statutory provisions...

title: Olga Tellis v. Bombay Municipal Corporation
headline: Supreme Court held that the right to livelihood is included in the right to life under Article 21. Pavement dwellers cannot be evicted without following due process of law. The court established that economic necessity that compels pavement dwelling deserves constitutional protection...

title: Vellore Citizens Welfare Forum v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court applied the precautionary principle and polluter pays principle in a case concerning tannery pollution in Tamil Nadu. The court directed closure of tanneries causing pollution and ordered them to pay compensation for environmental restoration...

citeList.title: MC Mehta v. Union of India (Oleum Gas Leak)

title: Hussainara Khatoon v. Home Secretary, State of Bihar
headline: Supreme Court held that the right to speedy trial is a fundamental right under Article 21. The court found that thousands of undertrial prisoners in Bihar were languishing in jails for periods longer than the maximum sentence for their alleged offences and ordered their immediate release...

title: Shayara Bano v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court declared the practice of instant triple talaq (talaq-e-biddat) as unconstitutional and violative of Articles 14, 15, 21, and 25 of the Constitution. The court held that triple talaq is not an essential religious practice entitled to protection under Article 25...

citeList.title: Shah Bano Begum v. Mohammad Ahmed Khan

title: State of Kerala v. N.M. Thomas
headline: Supreme Court upheld the constitutional validity of providing preferential treatment to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in public employment. The court held that Article 16(4) is not an exception to Article 16(1) but a facet of equality itself...

title: Bandhua Mukti Morcha v. Union of India
headline: Supreme Court landmark judgment on bonded labour and the right to live with dignity under Article 21. The court directed the government to identify, release, and rehabilitate bonded labourers. The court expanded the scope of public interest litigation and held that any citizen can approach the court on behalf of bonded labourers...

title: Kedar Nath Singh v. State of Bihar
headline: Supreme Court upheld the constitutional validity of the sedition law under Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code but limited its application. The court held that only speech or action that incites violence or public disorder constitutes sedition, not merely strong criticism of the government...
